doc:
Erle C. Kenton https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erle_C._Kenton 0 Erle C. Kenton (August 1, 1896 – January 28, 1980) was an American film director. He directed 131 films between 1916 and 1957. He was born in Norborne, Missouri and died in Glendale, California from Parkinson's disease. Kenton and Edward Ludwig were the principal directors of the 1958-1960 CBS television series, The Texan, starring Rory Calhoun as Bill Longley, a "Robin Hood of the West", who drifts through the region helping persons in need. Erle_C._Kenton ( August_1_,_1896 – January_28_,_1980 ) was an_American_film_director . He directed 131_films between 1916_and_1957 . He was_born in Norborne_,_Missouri_and died in Glendale , California from Parkinson 's_disease . Kenton_and_Edward_Ludwig were the_principal_directors of the_1958-1960_CBS_television_series , The_Texan , starring Rory_Calhoun as Bill_Longley , a_"_Robin_Hood of the_West_" , who drifts through the_region helping persons in need .
